title: All For The WINston
body_text:
It took seven incredible confrontations in nearly an eight-year span.. The enduring struggle between
ECD
's original set of sisters is finally over...
It was one of the greatest competitive displays in
ECD
's history and easily the best of the modern era. A final battle that included classic, prison, and even a designated "hitman" truly captured the enormity of the big time main event. The dreaded
Pick Your Poison
stipulation may have made all the difference as well.
From the very start, the Valerie-led coalition looked solid as if to mirror the sisters' series of matches. Who wouldn't be comfortable with a 4-1 advantage! Even the initial prison ball round favored the elder, securing a safe four-point edge over her "loving" little sister.
After the sophomore prison ball encounter, the tide began to turn - CXCIX and its combatants had themselves a match! Slowly but surely, Lauren squeaked one victory after another to eventually tie the historic contest in amazing fashion.
By this time,
ECD
's toughest and roughest knew this was it: no turning back, no tomorrow.
The sibling rivals, and their supporting casts, met at the center line to decide the future. Yes, one more game remained but each had their own road to glory:
- Valerie carefully selected
Goddess Mode
rules and for good reason: she had successfully eliminated her younger counterpart without error throughout the war.
- Influenced by her band of teammates, Lauren wisely chose the momentum-swinging prison ball. Since the stipulation, the "L-Army" valiantly fought back to even the score at 5-5.
And the result?
Prison Ball
which yielded a roar of cheers from Team LAUREN.
It came down to the deciding 11th some five nerve-racking minutes in duration. When the smoke cleared and the last weapon was hurled into the hands of the legendary Dan Spengeman,
Lauren had once and for all defeated her sister Valerie, 6 - 5.
Online Exclusive!
When
ECD
began, Valerie was 21 years young and Lauren a mere 19. Thank you both so very much for everything you've done!
Event Statistics
Attendance was seventeen (17). No new players were recorded.
The pair of sisters competed in their second
Pick Your Poison
matches. Lauren is undefeated having also vanquished Alison Bertsch at DODGEBALL 92 in June 2007. Valerie is unfortunately winless after previously suffering a loss to Pam D'Luhy at DODGEBALL 114 in December 2007.
Lauren's captains record improves to 6-5-3; Valerie falls to 3-6-3.
Lauren joins newly-inducted
ECDElitist
Juan Londono as the
only
competitors to win two
Pick Your Poison
bouts.
Joined by his girlfriend Pam, loving mother Elizabeth, and grandmother Gigi, your next
ECDElite
Hall of Famer is ..
JUAN LONDONO
♦ Player Profile: Born January 7, 1983; debut DODGEBALL 73 | January 23, 2007; player #247; right-handed
♦ Participation: Participated in 97 events
(13th highest)
= 77% since debut
(9th highest percentage ever)
♦ Career Highlights: 2x Season Finale headliner
(CXL & 150)
; 2x "Hit The Human" Contest Champion
(most all-time)
;
♦ Awards: "Rivalry of the Year" Award Finalist 2007 & 2008
(vs. T Adams, Wolf)
; "Rookie of the Year" Finalist 2007; "Captain of the Year" Finalist 2008
♦ Only captain in history to win
Pick Your Poison
,
CREAmation Rules
, and
GodMode Rules
matches
♦ Became first inductee to debut in 2007
♦ Became oldest member of
ECDElite
at time of induction: 30 years, 5 months, 23 days
(previous C Adams at 28 years, 6 months, 2 days)
Online Exclusive!
Throughout the entire month of June, current
ECDElitists
cast their vote for the final group of future members. Juan Londono far exceeded the minimum and was therefore inducted. Congrats once again!
body_html:
It took seven incredible confrontations in nearly an eight-year span.. The enduring struggle between ECD's original set of sisters is finally over...

It was one of the greatest competitive displays in ECD's history and easily the best of the modern era. A final battle that included classic, prison, and even a designated "hitman" truly captured the enormity of the big time main event. The dreaded Pick Your Poison stipulation may have made all the difference as well.

From the very start, the Valerie-led coalition looked solid as if to mirror the sisters' series of matches. Who wouldn't be comfortable with a 4-1 advantage! Even the initial prison ball round favored the elder, securing a safe four-point edge over her "loving" little sister.

After the sophomore prison ball encounter, the tide began to turn - CXCIX and its combatants had themselves a match! Slowly but surely, Lauren squeaked one victory after another to eventually tie the historic contest in amazing fashion.

By this time, ECD's toughest and roughest knew this was it: no turning back, no tomorrow.

The sibling rivals, and their supporting casts, met at the center line to decide the future. Yes, one more game remained but each had their own road to glory:
- Valerie carefully selected Goddess Mode rules and for good reason: she had successfully eliminated her younger counterpart without error throughout the war.
- Influenced by her band of teammates, Lauren wisely chose the momentum-swinging prison ball. Since the stipulation, the "L-Army" valiantly fought back to even the score at 5-5.

And the result? Prison Ball which yielded a roar of cheers from Team LAUREN.

It came down to the deciding 11th some five nerve-racking minutes in duration. When the smoke cleared and the last weapon was hurled into the hands of the legendary Dan Spengeman, Lauren had once and for all defeated her sister Valerie, 6 - 5.

Online Exclusive!
When ECD began, Valerie was 21 years young and Lauren a mere 19. Thank you both so very much for everything you've done!

Event Statistics
Attendance was seventeen (17). No new players were recorded.

The pair of sisters competed in their second Pick Your Poison matches. Lauren is undefeated having also vanquished Alison Bertsch at DODGEBALL 92 in June 2007. Valerie is unfortunately winless after previously suffering a loss to Pam D'Luhy at DODGEBALL 114 in December 2007.

Lauren's captains record improves to 6-5-3; Valerie falls to 3-6-3.

Lauren joins newly-inducted ECDElitist Juan Londono as the only competitors to win two Pick Your Poison bouts.


Joined by his girlfriend Pam, loving mother Elizabeth, and grandmother Gigi, your next ECDElite Hall of Famer is ..

JUAN LONDONO
♦ Player Profile: Born January 7, 1983; debut DODGEBALL 73 | January 23, 2007; player #247; right-handed
♦ Participation: Participated in 97 events (13th highest) = 77% since debut (9th highest percentage ever)
♦ Career Highlights: 2x Season Finale headliner (CXL & 150); 2x "Hit The Human" Contest Champion (most all-time);
♦ Awards: "Rivalry of the Year" Award Finalist 2007 & 2008 (vs. T Adams, Wolf); "Rookie of the Year" Finalist 2007; "Captain of the Year" Finalist 2008
♦ Only captain in history to win Pick Your Poison, CREAmation Rules, and GodMode Rules matches
♦ Became first inductee to debut in 2007
♦ Became oldest member of ECDElite at time of induction: 30 years, 5 months, 23 days (previous C Adams at 28 years, 6 months, 2 days)

Online Exclusive!
Throughout the entire month of June, current ECDElitists cast their vote for the final group of future members. Juan Londono far exceeded the minimum and was therefore inducted. Congrats once again!
